subject: Home & DIY
title: The Maximalism Revival
description: A quick, practical guide to The Maximalism Revival.

hook.text: For years minimalism ruled. Then people got tired of living in white boxes and started filling rooms with color again.

buildup.text: Maximalism mixes patterns, bold colors, eclectic collections, and rich textures in deliberate abundance.

discovery.text: The key difference from clutter: maximalism is curated chaos. Every object is chosen, not randomly accumulated.

twist.text: Research shows personality-filled spaces increase occupant wellbeing more than sterile minimal environments.

climax.text: Social media drove the shiftâ€”maximalist rooms photograph with drama and personality that white rooms can't match.

punchline.text: More isn't messy if every piece is chosen.

quiz.question: What distinguishes maximalism from clutter?
options: Every object is deliberately chosen and curated
More money is spent on each item
Rooms are larger to accommodate more furniture
